intro: Lotononis bainesii var. pottiae, commonly known as the Cape gold grass, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its vibrant colors and drought tolerance.
